intro: Verticordia huegelii var. tridens, commonly known as the Narrow-leaved Wattleflower, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. Its flowers are usually arranged in dense clusters and bloom during the cooler months, attracting various pollinators. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in native gardens.
